snippet: A rare daytime attack near the country’s most visible tourist attraction came as the government was reporting a rebound in foreign tourism.
abstract: Gunmen shoot and kill two Egyptian police officers in full daylight very close to the pyramids of Giza, a main tourist attraction; militant attacks on Egypt's security forces have become increasingly frequent, but none have been so close to such a heavily guarded tourism site; years of political turmoil have heavily impacted country's tourism industry, which has recently been on the rebound.

byline.original: By MERNA THOMAS and ALISON SMALE
byline.contributor: Merna Thomas reported from Cairo, and Alison Smale from Berlin. Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: A rare daytime attack near the country’s most visible tourist attraction came as the government was reporting a rebound in foreign tourism.

headline.main: Two Egyptian Policemen Shot Dead Near Pyramids of Giza
headline.print_headline: 2 Egyptian Policemen Shot Dead in Bold Attack Near Giza Pyramids

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
